channel.description: Recent content in Nutritional Science on ScienceChronicle

item.title: The Long-Term Effects of Consuming Foods with Negative Calories
item.description: Researchers from the New Yorkshire Institute of Medical Science have recently published a groundbreaking study on the long-term effects of consuming products with negative calories, such as celery, cucumber, cabbage, and others. According to the study, these foods have a highly reduced risk of metabolic diseases, especially diabetes, and a clear geroprotective effect due to their ability to balance micronutrients in the body. The study, led by Dr. Emily Johnson and her team, followed a cohort of over 10,000 participants for more than a decade.
